title: Juan Guaidó Is Voted Out as Leader of Venezuela’s Opposition
description: The vote to terminate the interim government signaled that members of the opposition had lost faith in Mr. Guaidó’s ability to oust President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Ukraine Defeats Russian Drone Swarm, as NATO Head Says Kyiv Needs More Arms
description: In a war where the vital weapons and tactics have changed repeatedly, Ukraine relies more than ever on air defenses to fend off barrages aimed at its energy systems and cities.

title: They Said They Went to Mali to Keep the Peace. Now They’re Jailed as Mercenaries.
description: Ivory Coast said its soldiers were in Mali to provide security for the United Nations peacekeeping mission. But Mali accused them of seeking to undermine its own security.

title: In Battered Ukrainian City, Workers Battle Winter, Not the Russians
description: Firefighters in Lyman, in Ukraine’s east, contend with land mines, freezing temperatures, damaged buildings, awful cell service and a lack of water.

title: Andrew Tate Is Detained in Romania in Human Trafficking Investigation
description: Mr. Tate, an online personality known for making misogynistic comments about women, was being held for 24 hours, the authorities said.

title: Attack on Oil Workers in Eastern Syria Kills at Least 10
description: No group claimed responsibility for the assault on a bus convoy. But Islamic State militants remain active in parts of Syria and have increased attacks in the area, which is government-controlled.

title: Ahead of Major Court Case, E.P.A. Revises Clean-Water Protections
description: A new rule revives an older set of protections for rivers, marshes and waterways, setting aside changes in the Obama and Trump administrations that led to years of legal wrangling.

title: Zelensky Signs Controversial News Media Regulation
description: The measure was passed this month as part of an effort lawmakers say was intended to help meet European Union conditions for membership, but journalists say it goes far beyond what the bloc requires.

title: ‘The Daily’ checks in with a Russian man who fled the draft.
A Continuing Drop in Murders
description: The situation changed for the better in 2022.

title: Xi and Putin Meet Again, Two Strongmen in a Weak Moment
description: Russia is isolated by its invasion of Ukraine and needs China more than ever. But China, facing a Covid crisis, is in no position to risk sanctions.

title: In the Pacific, Outcry Over Japan’s Plan to Release Fukushima Wastewater
description: The proposal has angered many of Japan’s neighbors, particularly those with the most direct experience of unexpected exposure to dangerous levels of radiation.

title: A Cop Called Coco, an Actor Named Mani, a Quebecer Exploring Quebec
description: When Mani Soleymanlou began acting, he was offered roles as stereotypical outsiders. That he now stars as a cop named Coco is indicative of broader shifts in a changing Quebec.

title: A Town-by-Town Battle to Sell Americans on Renewable Energy
description: In the fight against climate change, national goals are facing local resistance. One county scheduled 19 nights of meetings to debate one wind farm.

title: Putin and Xi to Speak, With Both Leaders Facing Crises
description: With Vladimir V. Putin’s war in Ukraine raging and Xi Jinping contending with a spiraling Covid outbreak in China, their call will put their ties on display.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Trial in Myanmar Nears End
description: The prosecution of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi has drawn international condemnation. A military court has sentenced her to 33 years in total.

title: Welcome to Little Kiwi, N.Y.C.
description: Young New Zealanders are once again venturing back out into the world.

title: 100 Years Since the Birth of the Soviet Union, in Pictures
description: It is the disintegration of the U.S.S.R. that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia says he wants to remedy by waging war against Ukraine; it is the legacy of Moscow’s dominance that Ukrainians hope to free themselves of by defeating Moscow.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Trial in Myanmar Nears End
description: The prosecution of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi has drawn international condemnation. The latest set of corruption charges could put her in prison for the rest of her life.
